news.title: Home sales in Toronto rise to five-month high in June
news.para: Toronto's housing market shows signs of recovery. Home sales in the Greater Toronto Area increased for the third month in June. However, home prices continued to fall. More homes are available for buyers. They are negotiating discounts. Lower borrowing costs are making homeownership more accessible. The Bank of Canada has cut interest rates.

news.title: Codename The One: A Signature Offering from Shriram Properties
news.para: Shriram Properties is launching Codename The One along Bangalore's NH 844, a strategic location near Electronic City and future infrastructure projects. This limited collection of 340 homes emphasizes thoughtful design with rooftop walkways, vertical gardens, and resident-exclusive amenities. The location offers proximity to major industries and developing transport corridors, presenting a promising opportunity for early buyers.

news.title: No separate civic body for merged areas by demerging PMC: Maharashtra industries minister
news.para: State Industries Minister Uday Samant announced that there are no immediate plans for a separate municipal corporation for Pune's newly merged areas, as the state government is providing funds for their development. MLC Yogesh Tilekar raised concerns about the strain on PMC's resources due to the merger.

news.title: Brigade Hotel Ventures raises ₹126 crore through pre-IPO placement round
news.para: Brigade Hotel Ventures secured ₹126 crore before its initial public offering. The company issued shares to 360 ONE Alternates Asset Management. This pre-IPO placement represents a 4.74% stake. The IPO size is now reduced to ₹774 crore.

news.title: Over 12,000 registered construction workers in Kodagu: Labour officer
news.para: In Kodagu district, 12,629 workers are registered under a welfare act. The Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board offers various benefits. These include pension, disability support, and toolkits.

news.title: Mahindra Holidays acquires Finland's property firm for ₹2.35 crore via subsidiary
news.para: Mahindra Holidays & Resorts India, via its Finnish arm Holiday Club Resorts Oy, has fully acquired Keskinäinen Kiinteistö Oy Salla Star for ₹2.35 crore. This all-cash transaction grants MHRIL complete ownership of a land parcel and building in Märkäjärvi, Finland, which HCR had been leasing since 2012.

news.title: Rajasthan imposes ban on sand mining till end of August
news.para: The Rajasthan government has imposed a two-month ban on sand mining in rivers to protect riverbeds and aquatic ecosystems during the monsoon season. This restriction is expected to cause a surge in sand prices due to limited supply and unrenewed leases.

news.title: Ghaziabad societies lacking rainwater harvesting to face fines up to ₹3 lakh
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority is cracking down on societies lacking or improperly maintaining rainwater harvesting systems, mandated for properties exceeding 300 sqm. This action comes as groundwater extraction rates in the district are critically high, with a depletion trend observed since 2017, despite higher recharge during monsoons.

news.title: Maharashtra government to raise rent for tenants of dilapidated cessed buildings
news.para: The Maharashtra government has pledged to raise the monthly rent allowance for tenants of dilapidated cessed buildings in Mumbai to ₹30,000 during reconstruction. Additionally, the government will revoke NoCs for developers who haven't initiated redevelopment projects under DCR 33(7).

news.title: Probe launched into illegal construction in Raisina hills
news.para: An investigation has been ordered into illegal construction in Sohna Aravalis' Raisina Hills following complaints of land clearing and tree felling. Divisional commissioner Ramesh Chandar Bidhan initiated the probe to identify those responsible for encroachments and environmental violations.

news.title: About 85 of 730 protected forest areas cleared of illegal buildings in Faridabad Aravalis
news.para: Haryana's forest department is actively demolishing encroachments in Faridabad Aravalis, acting on a Supreme Court order to treat PLPA-protected land as forest. Demolition drives have cleared 85 locations, with over 5,000 notices served for illegal structures like farmhouses and banquet halls.

news.title: Bombay HC asks BMC what it intends to do with buildings without fire NOC
news.para: The Bombay High Court has directed the BMC to clarify its stance on buildings lacking fire NOCs, questioning whether inaction implies tacit approval of potentially life-threatening situations. This directive came during a hearing regarding illegalities in a Tardeo building occupied without a fire NOC.

news.title: Akzo Nobel appoints Fredrik Westin as next CFO
news.para: Akzo Nobel, the maker of Dulux paint, has announced Fredrik Westin as its new CFO, effective January 1, 2026. He succeeds Maarten de Vries, who is retiring in April next year. Westin brings over 25 years of experience from the industrial and automotive sectors, most recently as CFO of Autoliv.

news.title: Lucknow development body to auction over 300 plots from July 4
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority will auction over 300 plots. These are residential and commercial plots in Lucknow. The e-auction portal will open on July 4. Registration is open until August 4. The online auction will be held on August 8. Plots are in Basant Kunj, Gomtinagar and other areas. These include group housing, school, hospital sites and more.

news.title: Rural development minister says allotment of five lakh PMAY houses in J&K soon
news.para: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that nearly five lakh homeless individuals in Jammu and Kashmir will soon receive housing under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. With Chief Minister Omar Abdullah present, Chouhan highlighted the near completion of existing allotments and plans for verification of newly identified beneficiaries.

news.title: Gujarat RERA concerned about NBFC funding for building projects
news.para: Gujarat RERA has identified significant irregularities in loan practices by builders and NBFCs, including mortgaging unsold inventory from other projects and disbursing funds without RERA registration. To safeguard buyer interests, GujRERA plans to engage with the state finance department to address the issue with the RBI.

news.title: Delhi Rent Control Act anachronistic legislation: Delhi HC
news.para: The Delhi High Court criticized the Delhi Rent Control Act as outdated, highlighting its misuse by affluent tenants who exploit it to occupy properties for extended periods while paying minimal rent, pushing landlords into financial distress.

news.title: Construction of houses in Goa under PMAY nears completion: Official
news.para: Under the project, there was a target of constructing 254 houses for eligible beneficiaries in the state, said P K Shirodkar, nodal officer in-charge of the scheme and director of the District Rural Development Agency.
